Testimony from Texas state Sen: Carlos Uresti stating that some constituents would have to drive up to 120 miles to secure a driver's license.
The question raised by U: S. Appeals Court Judge Robert L. Wilkins regarding the burden of traveling more than 100 miles for a driver's license.
The argument made by John Hughes: the attorney for Texas, that people who want to vote already have an ID or can easily obtain one.
The acknowledgment by U: S. Appeals Court Judge David S. Tatel that there is a subset of registered voters who lack ID and the consideration of the economic burden, particularly on minority communities.
